author: stoddard
msg: Have seperate variable on ap_writev to set the number of iovecs passed in
and pass back the number of bytes written. Use ap_iovec_t on the call rather
than struct iovec (I may reverse this tomorrow :-). Whatever we do, the network_io
and file_io calls need to use iovecs consistently, which isn't the case now.

author: stoddard
msg: Update Windows ap_filedup() call to recognise when it is asked to dup2
a standard i/o handle. Return error if the dup2 handle is not one of the
standard i/o handles (because Windows does not support a dup2 style function
to operate on native file handles)

author: stoddard
msg: APR is creating files by default whenever ap_open is called and the file
does not exist (i.e., passing OPEN_ALWAYS by default to CreateFile). This
causes .htaccess files to be created all over the place.

author: stoddard
msg: Return APR_ENOTIMPL on Windows if caller attempts dup2.
